Society would have tovelop a new set of values and beliefs: If immortality were discovered, it would likely lead to a fundamental shift in societal values and beliefs. People would have to reconsider what it means to live a fulfilling life, and whether the pursuit of wealth, power, and fame is truly worth it. This could lead to a more compassionate and sustainable society.

Overpopulation: With immortality, people would no longer fear death and would likely have more children. This could lead to overpopulation and a strain on resources, which would require society to develop new ways to sustain itself.

Immortality would change the of work: If people were immortal, they would no longer have to worry about retirement or providing for their families in the future. This could lead to a shift in the types of jobs people choose, and a greater focus on work that brings personal fulfillment rather than financial security.

Immortality would change the way we view death and dying: If immortality were discovered, it would likely lead to a greater acceptance and understanding of death and dying. This could lead to a more compassionate and supportive society for those who are facing the end of their lives.

Immortality would change the way we view time: With immortality, people would no longer view time as a finite resource. This could lead to a greater focus on living in the present and making the most of the time we have. It could also lead to a greater appreciation for the of life and a more mindful approach to living.
